name.text: Application of reciprocals given the number of hours 2 pipes takes to fill the same tank

questiontext.text:
If Pipe A can fill a tank in {@a@} hours, and Pipe B can fill the same tank in {@b@} hours:

a) What fraction of the tank does Pipe A fill in 1 hour?
[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

b) What fraction of the tank does Pipe B fill in 1 hour?
[[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

c) If both pipes work together, what fraction of the tank do they fill in 1 hour?
[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

d) How long will it take to fill the tank if both pipes work together?
[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] hours [[feedback:prt4]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

Part (a):
Pipe A fills tank in {@a@} hours
In 1 hour: fills \( \frac{1}{@a@} \) of tank (reciprocal of time)

Part (b):
Pipe B fills tank in {@b@} hours
In 1 hour: fills \( \frac{1}{@b@} \) of tank (reciprocal of time)

Part (c):
Fraction of tank filled by the 2 tanks in 1 hour: \( \frac{1}{@a@} + \frac{1}{@b@} = {@ta3@}\) of tank

Part (d):
Time to fill tank together = Reciprocal of combined rate
Time = \( \frac{1}{{@ta3@}} ={@ta@}\) hours

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

node.description: Checks for the correct fraction of the tank that Pipe A fill in 1 hour
Checks for incorrect fraction of tank filled by pipe A

truefeedback.text: You have failed to give the correct fraction and gave ({@a@} hours) instead of its reciprocal

node.description: Checks for the correct fraction of the tank that Pipe B fill in 1 hour
Checks for the incorrect fraction of the tank that Pipe B fill in 1 hour

truefeedback.text: You used the time ({@b@} hours) instead of its reciprocal. Remember rate is given by 1 รท time

node.description: Checks for the correct fraction of the tank filled when both pipes work together
Checks for incorrect fraction of the tank filled when both pipes work together

truefeedback.text: You added the times: \( \frac{1}{{@a+b@}} \).But we need to add the rates

node.description: Checks for incorrect fraction of the tank filled when both pipes work together

truefeedback.text: You have calculated the average of the times: \( \frac{@a+b@}{2} \).Rates add together, they don't average. Please check the worked solution below

node.description: Checks for the correct time taken to fill the tank when both pipes work together
Checks for the incorrect time taken to fill the tank when both pipes work together

truefeedback.text: You have added the times: \( @a+b@ \) yet when pipes work together, they fill faster, not slower. Kindly look at the worked solution below.
